name: gitbatch
description: Manage your git repositories in one place

repo.name: gitbatch
repo.description: manage your git repositories in one place

readme.summary: Clear concept with good installation options but lacks concrete usage examples, configuration details, and any troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No concrete examples of actual commands or workflows - just says 'run gitbatch' without showing what happens next or how to perform common tasks

injection_risks.description: The function configWithGit uses the 'git' command with user-controlled input (options.Site, options.Section, options.Option), which can lead to a command injection vulnerability.
The function addConfigWithGit uses the 'git' command with user-controlled input (options.Site, options.Section, options.Option), which can lead to a command injection vulnerability.

critical_findings: Command injection vulnerability in configWithGit and addConfigWithGit functions
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including command injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, but no secrets are hardcoded and error exposure is relatively low.

common_complaints: Keyboard input handling issues (Ctrl+Space on Mac, quit behavior inconsistency)
Crashes and panics (git worktree panic, multiple repo selection crash, memory errors)
Authentication problems (git credentials not being used, GitHub Pages auth issues)
UI rendering bugs (wiggly column lines, terminal compatibility issues)
Missing features (rebase instead of merge, lazygit integration)
praise_themes: Tool is considered helpful and useful overall
Good for batch operations across multiple repositories
sentiment.summary: Community shows moderate frustration with unresolved bugs and slow maintainer response; several high-priority issues spanning 5+ years suggest the project may be experiencing maintenance challenges.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are generally clear and helpful, showing patience with new contributors.

concerns: No commits in over 2.5 years (last commit May 2023)
22 open issues with no recent activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: gitbatch is abandoned with no development activity since May 2023 and accumulating unresolved issues.

project_metrics.description: manage your git repositories in one place

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good introduction to the package and clear installation instructions, but lacks sufficient examples and documentation on configuration and troubleshooting.
concerns: No commits in the past six months
A high number of open issues (19)
Docs: Insufficient examples and lack of documentation on configuration options
Security: Command injection vulnerability in configWithGit and addConfigWithGit functions
Security: The function configWithGit uses the 'git' command with user-controlled input (options.Site, options.Section, options.Option), which can lead to a command injection vulnerability.
Security: The function addConfigWithGit uses the 'git' command with user-controlled input (options.Site, options.Section, options.Option), which can lead to a command injection vulnerability.
High bus factor risk (96% from top contributor)
highlights: Recent merged PRs indicate some level of activity
Multiple contributors active in the past six months
